abstract.p: Shares of Boots Co PLC, British drug and beauty retailer, rise 3 percent on report in British newspaper The Independent that company may be purchased by Wal-Mart Stores Inc (S)

block.p: Shares of the Boots Company P.L.C., a British drug and beauty retailer, rose 3 percent, to 516 pence, on a report in The Independent on Sunday, a British newspaper, that the company may be purchased for $9 billion by Wal-Mart Stores Inc., the expansion-minded American retailing giant. Analysts said it was hard to see the rationale for such a deal as the two companies pursue markedly different business strategies. Wal-Mart concentrates on large out-of-town retail sites, while Boots' stores are smaller and placed in most of Britain's main urban shopping districts. Both companies declined to comment.

Analysts said it was hard to see the rationale for such a deal as the two companies pursue markedly different business strategies. Wal-Mart concentrates on large out-of-town retail sites, while Boots' stores are smaller and placed in most of Britain's main urban shopping districts. Both companies declined to comment.
